item.description:
What are our dreams telling us about our future? Edgar Cayce said, "Nothing important ever happens to us without first being previewed in dreams." Even Freud's patients had precognitive dreams. Have you ever dreamed something and had it come true? How can we recognize precognitive dreams? How can we encourage and increase precognitive dreams? We will share and discuss our precognitive dreams as well as techniques for recognizing and encouraging dreams of the future. Please feel free to share any such dream experiences you may have had. They could be little deja vu's, dreams of scenes you later see in the news, premonitions that later come true, or useful advice from dreams for situations that later come up in your personal life. Please come if you find the topic interesting, even if you have not had any precognitive experiences. Whether you have had precognitive dreams or not, this program will be fascinating and informative.

Deerheart will be facilitating. He is a visionary artist, a spiritual advisor, a practicing shaman, and a dream guide. An experienced explorer of the dream realms for for over 25 years, he has researched and studied many books and studied under many teachers. For more information about him, visit his website, Visionary Dream Guide.

Payment is $10 and can be made online or in person. Anyone who cannot afford to pay is encouraged to attend anyway and should contact the group organizer Deerheart before attending.

Event will be from 7 pm until 9 pm. Space is limited to 25 people. RSVP requested. Please update your RSVP if you are unable to attend, to allow others to attend. Thank you.

For directions and other information about Cambridge Swedenborg Chapel, please visit http://www.swedenborg...
item.how_to_find_us: Side entrance by the parking lot, up stairs, through hallway, left into parlor.
item.name: Dreams of Our Future
